properties.name: ACCENTURE LLP
properties.description:
FAST ISDW (DATA WAREHOUSE) SUPPORT SERVICES 
THIS PROJECT WILL:
DEVELOP A STRATEGY TO INSURE DATA COMMUNICATIONS ARE CONSISTENT ACROSS FSA.  CREATE A NEW DATA WAREHOUSE ENVIRONMENT CAPABLE OF SUPPORTING THE AGENCY'S ENTERPRISE REPORTING NEEDS. MIGRATE EXISTING INDIVIDUAL DATA MARTS TO THE NEW AGENCY-WIDE DATA WAREHOUSE ENVIRONMENT.  CREATE AN ENTERPRISE DATA WAREHOUSE FOR ALL OF FSA THAT PROVIDES A ONE-STOP-SHOP FOR FSA DATA, METADATA, AND CONSISTENT ACCESS METHODS FOR ENTERPRISE-WIDE REPORTING. A DATA WAREHOUSE IS A REPOSITORY OF THE ORGANIZATION'S ELECTRONICALLY STORED DATA AND IS DESIGNED SPECIFICALLY FOR REPORTING AND ANALYSIS.  IT PROVIDES THE MEANS TO RETRIEVE AND ANALYZE DATA, TO EXTRACT, TRANSFORM AND LOAD DATA, AND TO MANAGE THE DATA DEFINITIONS (METADATA).

THE FSA ENTERPRISE DATA WAREHOUSE IS TO PROVIDE INFORMATION TO FSA NATIONAL, STATE, AND COUNTY PERSONNEL.  IT IS EXPECTED TO BE CONTINUALLY EXPANDING BY BUILDING UPON EXISTING INFORMATION AND PROVIDING NEW BUSINESS-DRIVEN DATA THAT IS IMPORTANT TO FSA'S BUSINESS ENTERPRISE.  

THIS CONTRACT CONTINUES THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXPANSION OF THIS EFFORT.  HEAVY FOCUS WITHIN THIS PROJECT IS PLACED ON DATA QUALITY AS ENTERPRISE DATA FROM INDEPENDENT SYSTEMS IS INTEGRATED INTO A SINGLE REPORTING STRUCTURE.  THIS WILL NOT ONLY ALLOW FOR A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE DATA, BUT WILL RESULT IN VALIDATED AND CONSISTENT DATA, THUS ACHIEVING THE ABILITY TO "SPEAK THE SAME LANGUAGE."

THE TASK ORDER IS FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND PRODUCTION OF OUTREACH MATERIALS TO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE RECOVERY ACT (ARRA).  THE `GREEN RESERVE PROVISIONS OF THE ARRA PLACE AN EMPHASIS ON CERTAIN TYPES OF PROJECTS THAT ALSO SUPPORT EPAS GOALS UNDER OUR EXISTING SUSTAINABLE INFRASTRUCTURE INITIATIVE.   THE MATERIALS TO BE DEVELOPED ARE TO PROMOTE AWARENESS OF THESE PROVISIONS TO 1) ENCOURAGE THE SUBMISSION OF PROJECT PROPOSALS THAT MEET THE CRITERIA, 2) ENCOURAGE AMENDMENTS TO EXISTING PROJECTS WHICH MAKE THEM MORE SUSTAINABLE, AND 3) TO CONTINUE THE EMPHASIS ON SUSTAINABLE PROJECTS AND PRACTICES THROUGHOUT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE ARRA.

ALL OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN UNCHANGED.

properties.description:
RECOVERY - FXBM081107 - REPAIR TO LEED-TRANSPORTATION COMPLEX (B101, B102, & B104), ELLSWORTH AFB SD

CONSIST OF DESIGN, INVESTIGATE, AND REPAIR TO LEED TRANSPORTATION COMPLEX, BUILDIGS 101, 102, AND 104.  ACCOMPLISH ALL DESIGN, INVESTIGATE, AND REPAIR WORK FOR BUILDINGS 101, 102 ,AND 104 AS DETAILED IN THE STATEMENT OF WORK ACCOMPLISHING VARIOUS ENERGY AND FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS TO THE TRANSPORTATION COMPLEX (BUILDINGS 101, 102, AND 104).  AS A MINIMUM, THE FOLLOWING WORK SHALL BE ACCOMPLISHED:

A.	BUILDING 101:

I.	REPLACE OVERHEAD DOORS WITH 2 INSULATED OVERHEAD DOOR AND INSTALL NEW WEATHER STRIPPING.  INTERIOR FINISH SHALL BE SUITABLE FOR A CAR WASH ENVIRONMENT
II.	REPLACE EXISTING SIDING AND ROOFING.  NEW WALL PANELS SHALL BE R-19 WITH AN INTERIOR FINISH SUITABLE FOR A CAR WASH ENVIRONMENT.  NEW ROOF PANELS SHALL BE R-33 WITH AN INTERIOR FINISH SUITABLE FOR A CAR WASH ENVIRONMENT.  EXTERIOR COLORS TO MATCH BASE ARCHITECTURAL SCHEME.
III.	REPLACE EXISTING HOT WATER BOILER WITH HIGH EFFICIENCY, CONDENSING TYPE BOILERS.  REPLACE EXISTING PUMPS SERVING THE FLOOR HEAT SYSTEM.
IV.	REPLACE THE EXISTING CAR WASH HOT WATER HEATER WITH A HIGH EFFICIENCY, CONDENSING TYPE WATER HEATER.
V.	REPLACE EXISTING LIGHTING WITH ENERGY EFFICIENT LIGHTING.  INSTALL OCCUPANCY SENSORS WHERE APPLICABLE.  INVESTIGATE AND PROPOSE POSSIBLE DAY LIGHTING OPTIONS.
VI.	NEW MECHANICAL EQUIPMENT SHALL INCLUDE POINTS THAT TIE INTO THE EXISTING HONEYWELL CONTROL SYSTEM.  THE CONTRACTOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PROGRAMMING ALL NEW DEVICES INCLUDING PROGRAMMING ON THE EXISTING HONEYWELL EBI SYSTEM.

B.	 BUILDING 102:

I.	REPLACE EXTERIOR WINDOWS WITH 1 THICK THERMAL PANE WINDOWS, CLAD EXTERIOR AND INSIDE LIGHT LAMINATED FOR FORCE PROTECTION.  EXTERIOR CLAD COLOR AND INTERIOR FINISH TO MATCH EXISTING FINISHES.   INVESTIGATE THE POSSIBILITY OF INSTALLING INSULATED PANELS INSTEAD OF WINDOWS IN SOME LOCATIONS.
II.	REPLACE ALL SEALS AND WEATHER STRIPPING ON OVERHEAD DOORS.   
III.	REPLACE EXISTING LIGHTING WITH ENERGY EFFICIENT LIGHTING.  
IV.	REPLACE EXISTING ELECTRICAL TRANSFORMERS WITHIN THE FACILITY WITH HIGH EFFICIENCY K RATED TRANSFORMERS.

C.	BUILDING 104:

I.	REPLACE WALL INSULATION IN VEHICLE PARKING AREA WITH R-19 INSULATION.
II.	REPLACE MECHANICAL SYSTEMS THAT SERVE THE OFFICE AREAS.
III.	REFURBISH AND REACTIVATE THE AIR HANDLING UNIT IN THE VEHICLE PARKING AREA.
IV.	REPLACE EXISTING LIGHTING WITH ENERGY EFFICIENT LIGHTING.  
V.	NEW MECHANICAL EQUIPMENT SHALL INCLUDE POINTS THAT TIE INTO THE EXISTING HONEYWELL CONTROL SYSTEM.  THE CONTRACTOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PROGRAMMING ALL NEW DEVICES INCLUDING PROGRAMMING ON THE EXISTING HONEYWELL EBI SYSTEM.

2.	THE CONTRACTOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ACCOMPLISHING ALL DESIGN AND INVESTIGATIVE SERVICES FOR THIS PROJECT.

properties.description:
RECOVERY - FXBM085403 - REPAIR BACKYARD LANDSCAPE IN RUSHMORE HEIGHTS, ELLSWORTH AFB SD

REMOVE ALL EXISTING SHRUBBERY, PLASTIC BED EDGING AND WOOD MULCHING IN THE BACK YARDS OF 75 UNITS OF THE RUSHMORE HEIGHTS MILITARY FAMILY HOUSING COMPLEX. IN ALL THE DISTURBED AREAS, PROVIDE ADEQUATE TOPSOIL AND PLACE DROUGHT RESISTANCE SOD.  SOD WILL BE OF A DROUGHT RESISTENT HYBRID GRASS CROSSED BETWEEN A POA PARTENSIS AND POA ARCHINEFERA.  EXISTING TREES ARE TO BE PROTECTED FROM ALL DAMAGE DURING CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES.

THE COMPLEX SHALL BE DIVIDED INTO 4 SECTIONS: (1) WEST SIDE OF JEFFERSON DRIVE; (2) EAST SIDE OF JEFFERSON DRIVE; (3) WEST SIDE OF CLEVELAND; AND (4) EAST SIDE OF CLEVELAND. EACH SECTION MUST BE COMPLETED AND ACCEPTED BY CONTRACTING OFFICER BEFORE ANY WORK CAN BEGIN IN THE NEXT SECTION.
 
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SCHEDULING THE WORK; THE CONTRACTOR SHALL HAND-DELIVER A NOTICE TO EACH OCCUPANT 5 CALENDAR DAYS PRIOR TO THE FIRST DAY OF WORK IN THAT OCCUPANTS YARD.
  
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL INSTALL TEMPORARY FENCING (SNOW FENCE) ON THE HOUSE SIDE OF THE WORK AREA, TO ALLOW THE OCCUPANTS MAXIMUM USE OF THE REMAINDER OF THE BACK YARD FOR CHILDREN, PETS, ETC DURING WORK ACCOMPLISHMENT.

THE CONTRACTOR WILL BE ALLOWED TO REMOVE THE CHAIN LINK FENCING FABRIC ALONG THE BACK SECTIONS OF FENCE  FOR EASIER ACCOMPLISHMENT OF THE PRESCRIBED WORK, PROVIDING THE TEMPORARY FENCING LISTED ABOVE HAS BEEN INSTALLED.; AT COMPLETION OF THE WORK, THE FABRIC SHALL BE REINSTALLED TO THE SAME STANDARDS AS WHEN IT WAS REMOVED.

properties.description: THIS TASK ORDER OBLIGATES $13,884,549 FOR PREPARATION OF A WORK PLAN AND COST ESTIMATE FOR WORK TO BE PERFORMED AT THE SILRESIM CHEMICAL CORP. (SILRESIM) SUPERFUND SITE IN LOWELL, MA.  ONCE THE WORK PLAN AND COST ESTIMATE ARE APPROVED, ADDITIONAL RECOVERY FUNDS WILL BE OBLIGATED FOR COMPLETION OF THE EFFORT. THE PURPOSE OF THIS TASK ORDER IS TO IMPLEMENT A REMEDIAL ACTION (RA) AT THE SILRESIM SUPERFUND SITE.  THE CONTRACTOR WILL HAVE OVERALL RESPONSIBILITY FOR CONSTRUCTION OF A FINAL ENGINEERED BARRIER OVER A PORTION OF THE SILRESIM PROPERTY AND IMPLEMENTING THERMALLY-ENHANCED SOIL-VAPOR EXTRACTION (SVE) FOR THE REDUCTION OF VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (VOCS) IN SHALLOW SOIL AND GROUNDWATER.  ELECTRICAL RESISTANCE HEATING (ERH) WILL BE USED FOR VOC REDUCTION.  ERH IS A "THERMALLY-ENHANCED" VARIATION OF SVE THAT EMPLOYS ELECTRICAL CURRENT TO HEAT BOTH THE UNDERLYING SOIL AND GROUNDWATER; THE HEATED CONTAMINATED MEDIA LIBERATES SUBSTANTIALLY MORE CONTAMINATION WHICH CAN THEN BE CAPTURED, TREATED AND/OR DESTROYED.  THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE IS FROM 12 MAY 2009 THROUGH 30 APRIL 2011.  THE TASK ORDER NUMBER 045-RARA-0122.

properties.description:
SCOPE OF WORK
W912WL-09-D-0030
TASK ORDER 0001
EAAR-9016

           THE LOS ANGELES DISTRICT, U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS PROPOSED TO ISSUE A NEW POCA CONTRACT AND A NEW TASK ORDER FOR THE REPAIR OF THE HVAC SYSTEM FOR DORM QUAD BUILDING 2516 TO BUILDING 2519.

1.	THE HVAC SYSTEM SHALL BE PROPERLY MET AND SIZED TO PROPERLY CONDITION THE BUILDING IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE LATEST INDUSTRY STANDARDS INCLUDING CA T-24. COOLING SYSTEMS BASED ON ASHRAE 1% DESIGN DAY. FOR EDWARDS AFB THIS WILL BE 103 DEG F DRY BULB OUTSIDE AIR TEMPERATURE WITH A 68 DEGREE F MEAN COINCIDENTAL WET BULB. HEATING SYSTEMS BASED ON ASHRAE .6% DESIGN  DRY BULB OF 37 DEGREES F.  INDOOR DESIGN CONDITIONS WILL BE 75 DEGREES F COOLING SPACE TEMPERATURE AND 68 DEGREES F HEATING SPACE TEMPERATURE.

2.	FURNISH AND INSTALL A 4-PIPE UNDERGROUND HYDRONIC WATER DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM FOR THE EIGHT (8) DORM BUILDING IN THE HOUSING COMPLEX.  SIZING AND ROUTE OF PIPING DISTRIBUTION TO BE DETERMINED BY THE AIR FORCE.

3.	REMOVE REFRIGERANT FORM THE EXISTING DORMITORY A/C SYSTEMS USING GOVERNMENT FURNISHED CONTAINERS, AND RETURN TO THE 95 AWB/CETA HVAC SHOP.  PROVIDE AN INVENTORY OF THE AMOUNT OF REFRIGERANT RECOVERED.

4.	DEMOLISH THE FOLLOWING EQUIPMENT FORM EACH BUILDING: HOT WATER STORAGE TANK, BOILER, PUMPS, AND HOT WATER PIPE ON THE MECHANICAL ROOM SUFFICIENT TO ALLOW CONNECTION TO THE DOMESTIC HOT WATER PIPE.

5.	FURNISH NEW INDOOR 4-PIPE (HOT WATER HEATING/CHILLED WATER COOLING) FAN COIL UNITS (DESIGN PHASE OF THE PROJECT WILL DETERMINE EXACT SELECTION). STORAGE ROOM WILL HAVE HEATING ONLY FAN COIL UNITS.

6.	FURNISH AND INSTALL A 4-PIPE HYDONIC SYSTEM FOR THE DORM BUILDINGS.

7.	FURNISH AND INSTALL A TOTAL OF SIX (6) AMERICAN STANDARD D-80-512 DOMESTIC HOT WATER HEATER/BOILERS THROUGHOUT THE DORMITORY MECHANICAL ROOMS AS DIRECTED BY EAFB.

8.	INSULATE ALL NEW MECHANICAL PIPING AS NEEDED.

9.	PATCHING OF STUCCO OR DRYWALL.

10.	FLUSH CHILLED AND HOT WATER LOOPS WITH CLEAN WATER; CLEAN STRAINERS THROUGH-OUT THE SYSTEM.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION 21 IS TO OBLIGATE $409,000 IN INITIAL FUNDING IN SUPPORT OF WORK ASSIGNMENTS (WA 1-102 AND WA 1-103).  THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE FOR WORK ASSIGNMENT 1-102 WILL BE FROM JUNE 11, 2009 THOUGH DECEMBER 31, 2009.  THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE FOR WORK ASSIGNMENT 1-103 WILL BE FROM JUNE 15, 2009 THOUGH DECEMBER 31, 2009.

UNDER WORK ASSIGNMENT 1-102 THE CONTRACTOR IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE REVIEW OF DRINKING WATER STATE REVOLVING FUND (DWSRF) PROJECT PROPOSALS RECEIVED BY THE INDIVIDUAL STATE FOR ARRA FUNDING, DETERMINE WHETHER OR NOT THOSE PROJECTS HAVE A GREEN COMPONENT, AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR GREEN PRACTICES (E.G., MORE EFFICIENT PUMPS, WATER CONSERVATION DEVICES) THAT CAN BE INCORPORATED INTO THE PROJECTS.  A SECONDARY PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO STATES IN REVIEWING THE BUSINESS CASES THAT ARE SUBMITTED ALONG WITH PROJECTS IN SUPPORT OF CONSIDERING THEM AS GREEN PROJECTS.  THE WORK ASSIGNMENT WILL ALSO ADVANCE THE GOAL OF ENCOURAGING THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF PROJECTS THAT PROVIDE THE SOCIAL, HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS TO BE DERIVED FROM "ENVIRONMENTALLY GREEN" PROJECTS UNDER THE GREEN PROJECT RESERVE OF THE ARRA.  

UNDER WORK ASSIGNMENT 1-103 THE CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE EXPERTISE AND SUPPORT TO ASSIST EPAS EFFORT TO ASSURE AN EFFECTIVE, LEGAL AND APPROPRIATE EXPENDITURE OF ARRA FUNDS TO ACHIEVE THE OBJECTIVES OF THE ECONOMIC STIMULUS THROUGH SIGNIFICANT PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION AND OVERSIGHT. SUPPORT TASKS INCLUDE ASSISTING IN: REVIEWING EPA REGIONAL ARRA IMPLEMENTATION EFFORTS INCLUDING OVERSIGHT OF STATE ARRA PROGRAMS; DEVELOPING FACT SHEETS AND QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS (Q&AS) ON KEY ARRA ASPECTS AND ISSUES SUCH AS FLEXIBILITY IN SET ASIDES AND NEEDED TESTING OF FINANCIAL TRACKING APPROACHES; AND PROVIDING TRAINING TO EPA REGIONAL AND STATE DRINKING WATER STAFFS ON THE LATEST AGENCY ARRA POLICIES. 

ALL OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN UNCHANGED.

WA 3-103 IS TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF TOOLS AND TRAINING ALIGNED WITH THE UNIQUE ASPECTS OF THE ARRA FOR DRINKING WATER STATE REVOLVING FUND (DWSRF) STATE PROGRAMS AND THE BORROWER COMMUNITY OF THE DWSRF.  THIS SUPPORT WILL INCLUDE: (A) PARTICIPATING IN AND PROVIDING SUPPORT TO A FULL DAY WORKING SESSION WITH THE DWSRF PROGRAM TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF A PROGRAM OVERSIGHT STRATEGY FOR THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF THE ARRA FUNDS. THIS SUPPORT FOR THE WEBINARS SHALL CONSIST OF GETTING A WEB SEMINAR SERVICE, MANAGING REGISTRATION, AND RECORDING QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS DURING THE WEB SEMINARS.

THE CONTRACTOR SHALL EXPAND THE CBR DATABASE TO ALLOW FOR THE TRACKING OF ARRA ASSISTANCE TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND 3 U.S. TERRITORIES.

THE MODIFICATION ALSO REMOVES THOSE CLAUSES ASSOCIATED WITH CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTS USING ARRA FUNDS FROM THE CONTRACT.
